Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Autologous Bone Marrow Mononuclear Cells for Critical Limb Ischaemia

Intervention.evidence: intramuscular BMMNCs or control (conventional therapy, diluted autologous peripheral blood, or saline)

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy of intramuscular transplantation of autologous bone marrow mononuclear cells (BMMNCs) in CLI patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcomes were all-cause mortality, pain, and amputation, assessed over a 12-month period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 176 participants were randomised: 88 to the BMMNC group and 88 to the control group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Amputation rates showed a possible small effect (RR 0.52, 95% CI 0.27 to 0.99)

Harms.evidence: No significant differences were observed in side effects (RR 2.13, 95% CI 0.50 to 8.97).
